thread.title: Traditional apple crushing at Jersey cider festival
thread.title_full: Traditional apple crushing at Jersey cider festival | Channel - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Traditional apple crushing at Jersey cider festival
text:
Credit: DPA DEUTSCHE PRESS-AGENTUR / DPA / Press Association Images A traditional cider-making technique is set to be the main event at La Faîs’sie d’Cidre in Jersey this weekend.
The annual festival is returning to the Hamptonne Country Life Museum this year.
Organisers say the event is a family-friendly celebration of the islands rich heritage of apple growing and cider making.
The event just gets better and better year on year. There really is something for everyone, and, of course, plenty of cider!
– Nicola Lucas, Community Events Coordinator Local procucers and cider experts will be attending and there will be live entertainment, including Morris dancing.
It will run on from 10am-7pm on Saturday and 10am-5pm Sunday.
Last updated Sat 17 Oct 2015 Entertainment Jersey
